bibl.title: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Robert E. Noble, December 10, 1923

div1.p: Carter inquires if the Surgeon General's library has a book on the treatment of yellow fever with turpentine.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Robert E. Noble, December 10, 1923
div1.opener:
File - Book
Library--Bruce
/LC
2121 California St., N. W.,
, D. C.,
December 10, 1923.
Brigadier General Robert E. Noble, Librarian,
Library of the Surgeon General,
War Department,
Washington, D. C.
Dear General Noble:
div1.p:
Can you please tell me if there is in the Library a book by
----Bruce on the treatment of yellow fever by turpentine? I do
not know either the author's initials or the exact title of the book,
but there is reference to it in the little bulletin (“Las Epidemias
Amarillicas de Lima”) by Eysaguirre of that city, and if you haven't
it, I am going to write to Lima and see if I can borrow it.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, Assistant Surgeon General.
